Hi, I am Aa

I love learning software development! I started as an ITIL practitioner, completing and/or solving tickets end-to-end. Eventually, I decided to shift to programming, since this is what I want! I always give myself time to study new technologies, especially if it peaks my interest. I have 3 years of work experience with great thirst for knowledge!

Projects

© Aaron Cymor 2020

Redbull Myanmar

January 2020

Visit Site

Introduction

The company needed a website, and a chatbot to promote their products. I was mainly responsible for the continuing with our API server's improvements that handles all the chatbot's requests, and a simple website to advertise their promo. The backend provides rewards to winners with top-up / load to their phones.

Challenges

With only two weeks left to complete the project, I was given the opportunity to go to Myanmar, and finish the project. This was pretty challenging since, I am unfamiliar with some libraries like pyserial, and celery.

Approach

Before the development even started, I was already aware of the project's difficulty after making an assessment. I created my own version of documentation of the system to understand the its flow and how I can add my adjustments to fit the client's needs. Eventually, I was able to finish the project on time.

Rising Tide Digital

February 2020

Visit Site

Introduction

The company wanted a new look and feel for their website. It was already built with wordpress. The goal is to successfully interpret all the templates made by our Web Designer into fully functioning website.

Challenges

Having only 8 months of experience in PHP, and Wordpress, I needed to refresh my knowledge about these technologies since the last time I used them was around 2015. Also, I have been working more on backend related stuff lately, than in the frontend so I'm not that confident with my HTML, CSS, and Javascript skills. I am also really used to utilizing Bootstrap in most of our projects.

Approach

By allotting time to refresh my knowledge on frontend, PHP, & Wordpress I managed to complete the website on time. I was able to create wordpress shortcodes to generate custom cards. Website responsiveness was not that difficult anymore when I learned how to incorporate flex boxes, and grids. The approach made me became less reliant on Bootstrap, and other CSS frameworks.

Sunkist Myanmar

January 2018

Visit Site

Introduction

The company needed a website, to promote their products. The site has a page for promotion, and a simple CMS that allows them to change assets like videos, images, and some content.

Challenges

This was my first ever real project with Django, since I was just hired by the company to be their Fullstack developer focusing on Python.

Approach

I was already familiar with the language, and Django framework is not new to me. I have run through their documentation, and tried their tutorial. I used bootstrap to be more efficient. I was able to finish the website on time.
